recipe.name: Kabuli Pulao: Fragrant Basmati Rice with Tender Meat, Caramelized Carrots, Raisins, and Almonds
recipe.description: Kabuli Pulao is a beloved Afghan dish that combines fragrant basmati rice with tender meat, creating a flavorful and satisfying meal. The dish features a delightful mix of ingredients, including succulent meat (commonly lamb or chicken), caramelized carrots that add a touch of sweetness, plump raisins that infuse bursts of fruity flavor, and crunchy almonds that provide a delightful texture. The rice is cooked to perfection, absorbing the aromatic spices and juices from the meat, creating a harmonious blend of tastes. This classic Afghan recipe is a feast for the senses, with its enticing aroma, vibrant colors, and a balance of sweet and savory flavors that make it a true delight to savor.
ingredients: Basmati Rice: Fragrant long-grain rice that forms the base of the dish.
Tender Meat: Usually lamb or chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces.
Caramelized Carrots: Carrots sliced and sautéed until golden brown, adding a touch of sweetness.
Raisins: Plump raisins that provide bursts of fruity flavor and add sweetness to the dish.
Almonds: Slivered or whole almonds, toasted and added for a delightful crunch and nutty flavor.
Onions: Thinly sliced onions that are caramelized to add depth of flavor.
Garlic and Ginger: Aromatic ingredients that enhance the taste of the meat and rice.
Spices: Commonly used spices include cumin, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and black pepper, among others, to infuse the dish with a rich and aromatic flavor profile.
Ghee or Oil: Used for cooking the meat and rice.
Salt: To season the dish and bring out the flavors.
recipe.instruction: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for about 30 minutes, then drain. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat some ghee or oil over medium heat. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown and caramelized. Add the tender meat to the pot and cook until browned on all sides. Stir in minced garlic and ginger, and cook for an additional minute until fragrant. Add the soaked and drained rice to the pot, along with the caramelized carrots, raisins, and almonds. Gently mix everything together to distribute the ingredients evenly. Pour in enough water to cover the rice by about an inch. Season with salt and add the desired spices, such as cumin, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and black pepper. Stir well. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and let the pulao simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and tender. Once the rice is cooked, remove the pot from heat and let it rest, covered, for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. Fluff the rice with a fork to separate the grains and mix in the meat, carrots, raisins, and almonds. Serve the fragrant Kabuli Pulao hot, garnished with additional caramelized onions, if desired. It pairs well with yogurt or a side salad. Enjoy the aromatic and flavorful Kabuli Pulao with its tender meat, caramelized carrots, raisins, and almonds!

recipe.name: Mantu: Savory Afghan Dumplings filled with Seasoned Ground Meat, Served with Tomato Sauce, Yogurt, and Dried Mint
recipe.description: Mantu is a savory Afghan delicacy consisting of dumplings filled with seasoned ground meat, bursting with rich flavors. The tender dumpling wrappers encase a delectable mixture of spiced ground meat, usually beef or lamb, creating a satisfying and hearty bite. These dumplings are traditionally served with a vibrant tomato sauce that adds tanginess and complements the savory filling. A dollop of creamy yogurt is added on top, offering a cool and refreshing contrast to the warm dumplings. To finish, a sprinkling of dried mint adds a hint of aromatic freshness, elevating the overall taste experience.
recipe.instruction: Dumpling Dough: In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour and a pinch of salt. Gradually add water while kneading until a smooth and elastic dough forms. Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let it rest for about 30 minutes. Filling: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground meat, finely chopped onion, minced garlic, ground coriander, ground cumin, ground black pepper, and salt. Thoroughly mix the ingredients until well combined. Assembly: On a floured surface, roll out the dough into a thin sheet. Cut the dough into small squares, approximately 3x3 inches. Place a small amount of the meat filling in the center of each dough square. Fold the dough over the filling to form a dumpling, pinching the edges to seal. Steaming: Prepare a steamer or use a pot with a steamer insert. Place the assembled Mantu dumplings in the steamer, leaving space between them to prevent sticking. Steam the dumplings over medium heat for about 20-25 minutes, or until the dough is cooked and the filling is cooked through. Tomato Sauce: In a separate saucepan, heat some olive oil over medium heat. Add finely chopped onion and minced garlic, sautéing until softened and lightly golden. Add diced tomatoes or tomato puree, tomato paste, ground cumin, salt, and black pepper. Stir in vegetable or chicken broth and let the sauce simmer for about 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. Serving: Arrange the cooked Mantu dumplings on a serving platter. Pour the tomato sauce over the dumplings. Serve Mantu hot, garnished with a dollop of yogurt and a sprinkle of dried mint, if desired. Enjoy the delicious Mantu dumplings with their flavorful meat filling and complementing tomato sauce!

recipe.name: Ashak: Flavorful Dumplings filled with Leeks, Scallions, and Herbs, topped with Spiced Tomato Sauce and Yogurt
recipe.description: Ashak is a delectable Afghan dish consisting of flavorful dumplings filled with a mixture of leeks, scallions, and herbs. The dumplings are delicate, tender, and bursting with freshness. They are typically served with a spiced tomato sauce that adds a tangy and savory element to the dish. The addition of yogurt further enhances the flavors and provides a creamy balance. Ashak is often garnished with dried mint, adding a refreshing herbal note to the overall experience.
ingredients: Fresh herbs (such as cilantro, parsley, or dill), finely chopped
recipe.instruction: Dumpling Dough: In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour and a pinch of salt. Gradually add water while kneading until a smooth and elastic dough forms. Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let it rest for about 30 minutes. Filling: In a separate bowl, combine the finely chopped leeks, scallions, fresh herbs, minced garlic, ground coriander, ground cumin, salt, and black pepper. Mix the ingredients thoroughly to ensure an even distribution of flavors. Assembly: On a floured surface, roll out the dough into a thin sheet. Cut the dough into small squares or circles, approximately 3-4 inches in diameter. Place a small amount of the herb filling in the center of each dough piece. Fold the dough over the filling to form a dumpling, pinching the edges to seal. Tomato Sauce: In a separate saucepan, heat some olive oil over medium heat. Add finely chopped onion and minced garlic, sautéing until softened and lightly golden. Add diced tomatoes or tomato puree, tomato paste, ground cumin, salt, and black pepper. Stir in vegetable or chicken broth and let the sauce simmer for about 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. Steaming: Prepare a steamer or use a pot with a steamer insert. Place the assembled Ashak dumplings in the steamer, leaving space between them to prevent sticking. Steam the dumplings over medium heat for about 20-25 minutes, or until the dough is cooked and the filling is tender. Serving: Arrange the cooked Ashak dumplings on a serving platter. Pour the tomato sauce over the dumplings. Serve Ashak hot, garnished with a dollop of yogurt and a sprinkle of dried mint, if desired. Enjoy the delightful flavors of Ashak, with its herb-filled dumplings and tangy tomato sauce!

recipe.name: Bolani: Crispy Stuffed Flatbread with Mashed Potatoes, Onions, and Spices, served with Yogurt or Chutney
recipe.description: Bolani is a delicious Afghan dish that consists of a thin, unleavened dough filled with various ingredients. It is typically made with a mixture of mashed potatoes, leeks, or spinach, and seasoned with spices such as cumin and coriander. The dough is folded over the filling and pan-fried until crispy and golden brown. Bolani is often served as an appetizer or snack, accompanied by yogurt or chutney for dipping. Its combination of flavorful fillings and crispy exterior makes bolani a popular and satisfying dish.
ingredients: Flour: Typically all-purpose flour is used for the dough, but you can also use whole wheat flour or a combination of both.
Water: To mix with the flour and create the dough.
Filling of choice: Popular options include mashed potatoes, leeks, spinach, or a combination of these. You can also add additional ingredients like onions, garlic, or herbs for extra flavor.
Spices: Common spices used in bolani include cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder. Adjust the amounts based on your taste preferences.
Salt: To season both the dough and the filling.
Oil: Vegetable or olive oil for pan-frying the bolani.
Yogurt or chutney: Traditional accompaniments for bolani, which are served as dipping sauces.
recipe.instruction: Prepare the dough: In a mixing bowl, combine the flour and a pinch of salt. Gradually add water while kneading the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic. The dough should not be too sticky or too dry. Adjust the water or flour as needed. Divide the dough into small balls and let them rest for about 15-20 minutes. Prepare the filling: Choose your desired filling, such as mashed potatoes, leeks, or spinach. Cook or steam the filling ingredients until they are soft and well-cooked. Season the filling with spices like cumin, coriander, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Adjust the seasoning to your taste. Assemble and cook the bolani: Take one dough ball and roll it out into a thin, circular shape on a floured surface. Place a portion of the filling in the center of the rolled-out dough. Fold the dough over the filling to create a half-moon shape and press the edges to seal. Repeat this process with the remaining dough and filling. Pan-fry the bolani: Heat a pan or skillet over medium heat and add a few tablespoons of oil. Carefully place the bolani in the pan and cook until the bottom side is golden brown and crispy. Flip the bolani and cook the other side until it turns golden brown and crispy as well. Add more oil if needed. Serve and enjoy: Once cooked, transfer the bolani to a plate lined with paper towels to absorb any excess oil. Serve the bolani warm with yogurt or chutney for dipping. You can also cut the bolani into smaller pieces and serve it as an appetizer or snack. Remember, these instructions are a general guideline, and you can modify them based on your preferences and the specific filling you choose. Enjoy your homemade bolani!

recipe.name: Kadu Bouranee: Pan-fried Pumpkin with Garlic, Ginger, and Spices, topped with Tangy Tomato Sauce and Yogurt
recipe.description: Kadu Bouranee is a traditional Afghan dish featuring tender pumpkin cooked in a flavorful tomato-based sauce. The pumpkin is typically sautéed until it softens and then simmered in a spiced tomato sauce infused with aromatic spices like turmeric, cumin, and cinnamon. The dish is finished with a dollop of tangy yogurt and sprinkled with fresh herbs such as cilantro or mint. Kadu Bouranee offers a delightful balance of sweetness from the pumpkin, tanginess from the yogurt, and a hint of warmth from the spices, making it a delicious and comforting dish.
ingredients: 1 cup tomato puree or crushed tomatoes
Fresh cilantro or mint for garnish
recipe.instruction: Prepare the pumpkin: Peel the pumpkin, remove the seeds, and cut it into 1-inch cubes or bite-sized pieces. Sauté the onion and garlic: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until they become translucent and lightly golden. Add the spices and tomato: Add the ground turmeric, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir and cook for about 1 minute to toast the spices. Pour in the tomato puree or crushed tomatoes and stir well to combine with the spices and onions. Simmer the pumpkin: Add the cubed pumpkin to the skillet, stirring gently to coat it with the tomato sauce. Reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the pumpkin is tender and cooked through. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Serve: Once the pumpkin is cooked, transfer the Kadu Bouranee to a serving dish. In a separate bowl, whisk the yogurt until smooth. Top the cooked pumpkin with dollops of yogurt and sprinkle with fresh cilantro or mint leaves. Kadu Bouranee is typically served as a side dish alongside rice or Afghan bread. Enjoy the flavorful combination of pumpkin, spices, and creamy yogurt in this delicious Afghan dish!

recipe.name: Shola: Hearty Afghan Soup with Slow-cooked Legumes, Meat, Vegetables, and Aromatic Spices, served with Naan Bread or Rice
recipe.description: Shola is a traditional Afghan soup known for its hearty and comforting qualities. It features a rich broth made from meat, such as lamb or beef, along with a variety of legumes like lentils and chickpeas. The soup is flavored with aromatic spices like cumin, turmeric, and garlic, which lend a warm and earthy flavor profile. Vegetables like onions, carrots, and potatoes are often added for additional texture and flavor. Shola is typically served hot and is a popular choice during colder months, offering a satisfying and nourishing meal option.
ingredients: 1 pound lamb or beef, cut into cubes
1 cup dried lentils (preferably brown or green)
1 cup dried chickpeas, soaked overnight (or canned chickpeas)
Fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish
recipe.instruction: Prepare the legumes: If using dried chickpeas, soak them overnight in water. Drain and rinse them before cooking. Rinse the lentils thoroughly under running water. Cook the meat and onions: In a large pot, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the meat cubes and brown them on all sides. Remove the meat from the pot and set it aside. In the same pot, add the chopped onions and cook until they become soft and translucent. Add the spices and legumes: Add the minced garlic, ground cumin, ground turmeric, salt, and pepper to the pot. Stir well to coat the onions in the spices. Return the browned meat to the pot and add the soaked chickpeas and rinsed lentils. Pour enough water into the pot to cover the ingredients by a couple of inches. Simmer the soup: Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Allow the soup to simmer for about 1 to 1.5 hours, or until the meat is tender and the legumes are cooked through. Stir occasionally and add more water if needed to maintain the desired consistency. Add vegetables and serve: Add the diced carrots and cubed potatoes to the pot. Cook for an additional 20-30 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Adjust the seasoning if necessary, adding more salt and pepper to taste. Serve the Shola soup hot, garnished with fresh cilantro or parsley. Squeeze some lemon juice over each serving if desired. Shola is often enjoyed with Afghan bread or rice. It's a hearty and flavorsome soup that is perfect for warming up on chilly days. Enjoy!

recipe.name: Bamya Palaw: Aromatic Okra Rice with Tender Meat, Fragrant Spices, and Caramelized Onions
recipe.description: Bamya Palaw is a delicious Afghan dish renowned for its rich flavors and textures. It consists of tender chunks of lamb or beef cooked with okra (bamya) in a flavorful tomato-based sauce. The meat and okra are simmered together with aromatic spices such as cumin, coriander, and turmeric, creating a fragrant and savory taste. The dish is served over a bed of fluffy basmati rice, allowing the flavors to meld together. Bamya Palaw is a comforting and hearty meal that showcases the fusion of Afghan and Middle Eastern culinary influences.
ingredients: 1 kg lamb or beef, cut into chunks
Chopped fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish (optional)
recipe.instruction: Rinse the basmati rice in cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for about 30 minutes, then drain and set aside. In a large pot, heat some vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add the minced garlic to the pot and sauté for another minute, until fragrant. Add the meat chunks to the pot and brown them on all sides. Stir in the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, cumin, coriander, turmeric, paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix well to coat the meat with the spices. Pour enough water into the pot to cover the meat. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the meat becomes tender. Meanwhile, in a separate pan, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the trimmed okra and sauté for a few minutes until slightly tender. Remove from heat and set aside. Once the meat is tender, add the sautéed okra to the pot and gently stir to combine. Let it simmer for another 15-20 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. In a separate pot, bring water to a boil and add the soaked and drained rice. Cook the rice according to the package instructions until it is tender but still firm. Drain the cooked rice. To serve, place a layer of cooked rice on a platter or individual plates, and spoon the Bamya Palaw mixture on top. Garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley if desired. Enjoy your flavorful Bamya Palaw! Note: Feel free to adjust the spices and seasoning according to your taste preferences. You can also add other vegetables such as carrots or bell peppers if desired.

recipe.name: Chapli Kebab: Flavorful Spiced Beef Patties with Fresh Herbs, Served with Naan Bread and Mint Yogurt Sauce
recipe.description: Chapli kebab is a traditional Pakistani dish known for its delicious flavor and unique texture. It consists of minced meat, typically beef or lamb, mixed with a variety of spices such as cumin, coriander, and chili powder. The mixture is then shaped into round patties with a depression in the center, allowing it to cook evenly. The kebabs are typically grilled or pan-fried until they develop a crispy outer layer and juicy interior. They are often served with naan bread, salad, and yogurt sauce, making them a delightful and satisfying meal.
recipe.instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the minced meat, chopped onion, coriander leaves, mint leaves, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, ginger paste, garlic paste, egg, and salt. Mix everything well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated. Let the mixture marinate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. Once the mixture has marinated, take a handful of the mixture and shape it into a round patty. Make a small depression in the center of each patty to help them cook evenly. Heat a frying pan or grill pan over medium heat and add some oil to coat the surface. Place the chapli kebabs on the pan and cook them for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and develop a crispy, brown crust. Once the kebabs are cooked, remove them from the pan and drain any excess oil on a paper towel. Your delicious chapli kebabs are now ready to be served! They can be enjoyed with naan bread, salad, and a yogurt-based sauce or chutney of your choice.

recipe.name: Mazari Chicken White Karahi: Spicy Chicken Curry with Tomatoes, Peppers, and Fragrant Spices, Served with Naan Bread or Rice
recipe.description: Mazari Chicken White Karahi is a popular Pakistani dish known for its creamy and flavorful taste. Tender chicken pieces are cooked in a rich gravy made from a blend of yogurt, cream, and spices. The dish is characterized by its white color and aromatic flavors, which come from ingredients like ginger, garlic, and green chilies. The karahi is typically garnished with fresh coriander leaves and served with naan or rice for a satisfying meal. Its creamy texture and delectable taste make it a favorite among chicken lovers.
recipe.instruction: In a pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds and sauté for a minute until they splutter and become fragrant. Add the chopped onions to the pan and cook until they turn golden brown. Stir occasionally to prevent burning. Add the ginger-garlic paste and green chilies to the pan. Cook for another minute, stirring continuously. Now, add the chicken pieces to the pan and cook until they are lightly browned. In a separate bowl, whisk together the yogurt, cream, white pepper powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Pour this mixture into the pan with the chicken and stir well to combine. Reduce the heat to low and let the chicken simmer in the creamy gravy for about 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Sprinkle the garam masala over the chicken and give it a final stir. Garnish the Mazari Chicken White Karahi with fresh coriander leaves. Your Mazari Chicken White Karahi is now ready to be served. Enjoy it with naan bread, roti, or rice for a delicious and comforting meal.

recipe.name: Sabzi Chalaw: Fragrant Herbed Rice with Slow-cooked Spinach, Garlic, and Cumin-flavored Beef
recipe.description: Sabzi Chalaw, also known as Afghan Vegetable Pilaf, is a delightful and flavorful dish from Afghanistan. It features a fragrant and aromatic rice pilaf cooked with a medley of vegetables. The vegetables, such as carrots, peas, and cauliflower, are sautéed in a blend of spices and then mixed with long-grain rice, creating a colorful and vibrant dish. The pilaf is cooked until the rice is fluffy and each grain is separate. Sabzi Chalaw is often served as a main course or as a side dish alongside grilled meats or kebabs, adding a wholesome and nutritious element to the meal.
recipe.instruction: Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain and set aside. In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and let them splutter for a few seconds. Add the chopped onion to the pot and sauté until it becomes translucent and lightly golden. Add the diced carrots, cauliflower florets, and frozen peas to the pot. Stir well to combine with the onions. Sprinkle the turmeric powder, ground coriander, ground cumin, and salt over the vegetables. Mix everything together and cook for 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. Add the soaked and drained rice to the pot and gently stir to coat the rice with the vegetable mixture. Pour enough water into the pot to cover the rice by about an inch. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and fluffy. Once the rice is cooked, remove the pot from the heat and let it sit, covered, for an additional 5 minutes to steam. Fluff the rice with a fork, garnish with fresh cilantro, and serve hot. Your Sabzi Chalaw is now ready to be enjoyed as a flavorful and wholesome dish. Serve it as a main course or as a side dish alongside your favorite meats or kebabs.

recipe.name: Sheer Khurma: Creamy Vermicelli Pudding with Milk, Dates, Nuts, and Fragrant Cardamom, a Traditional Afghan Dessert
recipe.description: Sheer Khurma is a traditional Afghnai, Indian and Pakistani dessert known for its rich and creamy taste. The dish translates to 'milk with dates' and is made by simmering vermicelli, milk, and dates in a fragrant mixture of ghee and cardamom. It is further enhanced with the addition of nuts such as almonds, pistachios, and cashews, providing a delightful crunch. Sheer Khurma is often enjoyed during festive occasions like Eid and is served warm or chilled as a sweet and indulgent treat.
ingredients: 1/4 cup mixed nuts (almonds, pistachios, cashews), chopped
recipe.instruction: Heat ghee in a deep pan or pot over medium heat. Add the vermicelli and sauté until it turns golden brown. Keep stirring to ensure even browning. Pour the milk into the pan with the vermicelli. Stir well and bring it to a gentle boil. Reduce the heat to low and let the milk simmer for about 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent it from sticking to the bottom. Add the chopped dates and mixed nuts to the simmering milk. Continue to cook for another 5-10 minutes until the dates soften and the flavors meld together. Stir in the sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands (if using). Mix well until the sugar dissolves completely. Cook for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. Remove the pan from heat and let the Sheer Khurma cool slightly. You can choose to add a few drops of rosewater or kewra essence at this stage for added fragrance. Serve the Sheer Khurma warm or chilled, garnished with chopped dry fruits if desired. Enjoy this creamy and delicious Sheer Khurma as a sweet ending to your meal or during festive occasions.

recipe.name: Aushak: Scrumptious Afghan Dumplings filled with Scallions, Herbs, and Ground Lamb, Topped with Tomato Sauce and Mint Yogurt
recipe.description: Aushak is a traditional Afghan dish that consists of delicate dumplings filled with a mixture of herbs, typically scallions, and served with a flavorful tomato-based sauce. The dumplings are made with a thin dough, carefully folded and sealed, then boiled until tender. Once cooked, they are topped with the tangy tomato sauce and often garnished with a dollop of yogurt and a sprinkle of dried mint. Aushak is loved for its vibrant flavors, fresh herbs, and comforting textures, making it a popular choice in Afghan cuisine.
ingredients: 2 cups fresh herbs (scallions or leeks), finely chopped
recipe.instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt. Gradually add water and knead the mixture until a smooth and elastic dough is formed. Cover the dough and let it rest for about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the filling by mixing the finely chopped herbs with salt and ground black pepper in a separate bowl. Roll out the dough into a thin sheet on a lightly floured surface. Cut the dough into small circles or squares, approximately 2-3 inches in diameter. Place a small amount of the herb filling in the center of each dough piece. Fold the dough over to form a half-moon shape and pinch the edges to seal the dumplings. Repeat the process until all the dough and filling are used. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Carefully drop the dumplings into the boiling water and cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until they float to the surface. Remove the dumplings from the water with a slotted spoon and set them aside. Heat vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add the crushed tomatoes, ground coriander, ground cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the saucepan. Stir well to combine. Simmer the sauce for about 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together and the sauce to thicken. Arrange the cooked dumplings on a serving platter. Pour the tomato sauce over the dumplings, ensuring they are well coated. Garnish with a dollop of yogurt and a sprinkle of dried mint. Serve the Aushak warm and enjoy the delightful flavors of the herb-filled dumplings with the tangy tomato sauce. It can be enjoyed as a main course or as part of a larger Afghan meal.

recipe.name: Chalow Kebab: Succulent Grilled Skewered Meat, Marinated in Spices and Yogurt, Served with Saffron-infused Rice
recipe.description: Chalow Kebab is a traditional Afghan dish consisting of succulent grilled or roasted kebabs served with fragrant and fluffy long-grain rice known as 'chalow.' The kebabs are typically made with minced lamb or beef, mixed with a variety of spices and herbs, then shaped into long, cylindrical skewers. The kebabs are cooked to perfection, resulting in a tender and flavorful meat. The chalow rice complements the kebabs beautifully, creating a satisfying and aromatic meal that is enjoyed across Afghanistan.
ingredients: Skewers (if using wooden skewers, soak them in water for 30 minutes before grilling)
recipe.instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the minced meat, chopped onion, minced garlic, cilantro, mint, ground cumin, ground coriander, salt, and black pepper. Mix everything well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated. Take a handful of the mixture and shape it into a long, cylindrical kebab. Repeat the process until all the mixture is used. If using wooden skewers, thread the kebabs onto the soaked skewers. Preheat your grill or oven to medium-high heat. Grill the kebabs for about 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, or until they are cooked through and nicely charred. Alternatively, you can cook the kebabs in a preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for about 15-20 minutes. While the kebabs are cooking, prepare the chalow rice. Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. In a pot, bring the water to a boil and add salt. Add the rinsed rice to the boiling water and cook until it is tender and fluffy, usually around 10-12 minutes. Drain the rice and set it aside. Once the kebabs are cooked, remove them from the grill or oven and let them rest for a few minutes. Serve the Chalow Kebabs alongside the fluffy chalow rice. You can also add some grilled vegetables or a side salad for a complete meal. Enjoy the delicious Chalow Kebabs with the fragrant chalow rice for a flavorful Afghan culinary experience!

recipe.name: Shorwa-e-Gosht: Hearty Afghan Lamb Soup with Vegetables, Lentils, and Aromatic Spices, Served with Bread or Naan
recipe.description: Shorwa-e-Gosht is a hearty and flavorful Afghan meat soup made with tender chunks of lamb or beef simmered with aromatic spices and vegetables. The soup is known for its rich and comforting broth, which is achieved by slow-cooking the meat with onions, garlic, and a blend of spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric. The addition of vegetables such as carrots and potatoes enhances the flavors and adds texture to the soup. Shorwa-e-Gosht is often served with naan bread or rice, making it a satisfying and nourishing meal option.
ingredients: 500 grams lamb or beef, cut into chunks
Fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish
recipe.instruction: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and sauté for a minute until they start to sizzle and release their aroma. Add the chopped onions to the pot and cook until they become translucent and golden brown. Stir occasionally to prevent burning. Add the minced garlic to the pot and cook for another minute, stirring continuously. Place the chunks of lamb or beef into the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides. Add the ground coriander, ground turmeric, and chili powder (if using) to the pot. Stir well to coat the meat with the spices. Pour enough water into the pot to cover the meat by a couple of inches. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the meat is tender and cooked through. Skim off any impurities that rise to the surface. Add the diced carrots, diced potatoes, and chopped tomatoes to the pot. Season with salt to taste. Continue to simmer for another 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. Taste the soup and adjust the seasoning if needed. Serve the Shorwa-e-Gosht hot, garnished with fresh cilantro or parsley. Enjoy the comforting and flavorful Shorwa-e-Gosht with naan bread or rice for a satisfying meal.

recipe.name: Borani Banjan: Fried Eggplant with Tomato Sauce, Tangy Yogurt, and Fresh Herbs, a Classic Afghan Appetizer
recipe.description: Borani Banjan is a traditional Afghan dish consisting of fried eggplant slices topped with a flavorful tomato-based sauce and a layer of tangy yogurt. The eggplant is typically cooked until golden brown and crispy, while the sauce is made with tomatoes, onions, garlic, and a blend of spices. The dish is then finished off with a generous dollop of yogurt, creating a creamy and refreshing contrast to the savory flavors. Borani Banjan is often served as a side dish or as part of a larger Afghan meal.
ingredients: Fresh cilantro or mint for garnish
recipe.instruction: Start by preparing the eggplants. Peel the eggplants and cut them into thick slices. Place the slices in a colander and sprinkle salt over them. Let them sit for about 15-20 minutes to draw out any bitter juices. Rinse the eggplant slices and pat them dry with a paper towel. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat. Fry the eggplant slices in batches until they turn golden brown and are cooked through. Place the fried eggplants on a paper towel to remove excess oil. In a separate pan, heat a little vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and minced garlic. Sauté until the onions become soft and translucent. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pan and cook until they start to break down and release their juices. Stir in the ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, chili powder (if using), and salt. Mix well to combine the spices with the tomato mixture. Cook for a few minutes until the flavors meld together. Place the fried eggplant slices into the pan with the tomato mixture, gently pressing them down to absorb the flavors. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 10-15 minutes, allowing the eggplants to further cook and absorb the sauce. In a small bowl, whisk the yogurt until smooth. To serve, arrange the eggplant slices on a serving platter. Pour the yogurt over the eggplants, creating a layer of creamy goodness. Garnish with fresh cilantro or mint. Borani Banjan can be enjoyed as a side dish or as part of a larger Afghan meal. Serve it with naan bread or rice for a complete culinary experience.

name: Karim Azimi
description: Karim Azimi is a seasoned Afghan chef with a remarkable culinary journey spanning over 15 years. He is widely regarded as a master of Afghan cuisine, having honed his skills in renowned kitchens across the country. With an impressive repertoire of 80 unique recipes, Karim's culinary creations showcase the diverse flavors and regional specialties of Afghanistan. His dishes have garnered immense praise, accumulating a staggering 4500 likes. Karim's passion for culinary excellence and his meticulous attention to detail make each of his creations a true work of art, elevating Afghan cuisine to new heights.

recipe.name: Murg Korma: Creamy Chicken Curry with Cashews, Yogurt, and Fragrant Spices, Served with Naan Bread or Rice
recipe.description: Murg Korma is a classic Afgani, Indian dish known for its rich and creamy gravy, made with tender chicken pieces cooked in a flavorful blend of spices and yogurt. The dish features a harmonious combination of aromatic spices such as cumin, coriander, and cardamom, which infuse the chicken with a delightful flavor. The creamy texture is achieved by adding yogurt and sometimes cream or cashew paste. Murg Korma is often garnished with fresh cilantro and served with naan bread or rice, making it a popular and indulgent choice in Indian cuisine.
ingredients: 500 grams chicken pieces, bone-in or boneless
recipe.instruction: Heat ghee or vegetable oil in a large pan or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds. Add the chopped onions to the pan and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pan. Cook for another minute until the raw smell disappears. Add the chicken pieces to the pan and cook until they are lightly browned on all sides. Stir in the ground coriander, turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt. Mix well to coat the chicken with the spices. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pan and cook until they soften and release their juices. Reduce the heat to low and add the yogurt to the pan. Stir well to combine with the chicken and spices. Cook for a few minutes until the yogurt is well incorporated. If using cashew paste, add it to the pan and mix well. This will help thicken the gravy and add richness to the dish. Cover the pan and let the chicken simmer on low heat for about 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Sprinkle the garam masala over the chicken and give it a final stir. Cook for another minute to allow the flavors to meld together. Garnish the Murg Korma with fresh cilantro. Serve the delicious Murg Korma hot with naan bread or rice. It pairs well with a side of raita or salad for a complete meal. Enjoy the rich and creamy flavors of this traditional Indian dish!

recipe.name: Chapli Pulao: Fragrant Rice Pilaf with Spiced Beef Patties, Caramelized Onions, and Saffron-infused Flavors
recipe.description: Chapli Pulao is a popular Afghani, Pakistani rice dish known for its unique blend of flavors and textures. It combines aromatic Basmati rice cooked with a medley of tender meat, such as chicken or beef, and a variety of aromatic spices. The dish is further enriched with the addition of caramelized onions, tomatoes, and a mix of whole and ground spices. The result is a fragrant and flavorful pulao that is often garnished with fried onions and served with raita or yogurt on the side, making it a delicious and satisfying meal option.
ingredients: 500 grams chicken or beef, cut into small pieces
recipe.instruction: Wash the Basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for about 30 minutes, then drain and set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add the ginger-garlic paste to the pot and cook for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Add the chopped tomatoes, green chilies, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few minutes until the tomatoes soften. Add the chicken or beef pieces to the pot and cook until they are browned on all sides. Add enough water to the pot to cook the rice. For every cup of rice, use 1.5 cups of water. Bring the water to a boil. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot. Give it a gentle stir. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let the rice cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until it is cooked and the water is absorbed. Avoid stirring the rice while it's cooking to prevent it from becoming mushy. Once the rice is cooked, fluff it up gently with a fork. Garnish the Chapli Pulao with fresh cilantro and fried onions (optional). Serve the flavorful Chapli Pulao hot with raita or yogurt on the side. It makes for a satisfying and delicious meal on its own or as part of a larger Pakistani feast. Enjoy!

recipe.name: Firnee: Creamy Cardamom-flavored Afghan Rice Pudding with Rosewater, Served Chilled and Garnished with Pistachios
recipe.description: Firnee is a traditional South Asian dessert known for its creamy and velvety texture. It is made by simmering milk with rice flour or ground rice until it thickens and develops a smooth consistency. The pudding is sweetened with sugar and flavored with aromatic ingredients such as cardamom, rose water, or saffron. Firnee is often garnished with chopped nuts, such as pistachios or almonds, to add a delightful crunch. Served chilled, Firnee is a delectable and refreshing dessert that is enjoyed on special occasions and celebrations.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons rice flour or ground rice
Chopped nuts (such as pistachios or almonds) for garnish
recipe.instruction: In a saucepan, bring the milk to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent the milk from sticking to the bottom of the pan. In a separate bowl, mix the rice flour or ground rice with a little water to form a smooth paste. Make sure there are no lumps. Gradually pour the rice flour or ground rice mixture into the simmering milk while stirring continuously. This will help thicken the milk and create a smooth texture. Add the sugar to the milk mixture and continue to cook on low heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens to a pudding-like consistency. This usually takes around 20-25 minutes. Stir in the cardamom powder, rose water (if using), and saffron strands (if using). Mix well to incorporate the flavors. Remove the pan from heat and let the Firnee cool to room temperature. As it cools, it will thicken further. Once cooled, transfer the Firnee to individual serving bowls or a larger serving dish. Garnish with chopped nuts. Refrigerate the Firnee for at least a couple of hours, or until chilled and set. Serve the delicious and creamy Firnee chilled as a delightful dessert. Enjoy the rich flavors and the crunch of the nuts. It is often served on festive occasions or as a sweet treat after a meal.
